revised_title: Supplementary Report on Explorations of Erect Trees with Animal Remains in Nova Scotia Coal Formation and the Hippocampus in Anosmatic Animals
tldr: The author presents a supplementary report on the exploration of erect trees containing animal remains in the coal formation of Nova Scotia, discussing the findings of Dr. Scudder on the remains of arthropods and scorpions. Additionally, the paper includes a study on the hippocampal region of the brain in anosmatic animals, comparing the development of the hippocampus in various species.
